topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54bcbde86368721ce1e30f00#post_54bcbde86368721ce1e30f00
[bq="trashboat"]"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54bcbd0a6368722346091100#post_54bcbd0a6368722346091100
[spoiler]Basically, Both Adam and Lillith arrived to earth at the same time. Humans spawned from Lillith, And Angels spawned from Adam. (The Angels weren't awoken until an arctic exploration group ended up waking up adam through brief contact with lillith DNA.)[/spoiler][/bq]
Technically speaking Adam was first on Earth, but Lilith's impact on Earth destroyed Adam's lance and forced Adam to become dormant until the artic exploration.

Side note: first ancestral race, "oops!"

...Since I'm more with the other group of Jackasses, I can't come up with any good points on *How* We're being jackasses here.

Edit: Evangelion's plot isn't homestuck or 2001 level, But it's not like only stupid people can't figure it out.

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54bcbf3d636872295a360e00#post_54bcbf3d636872295a360e00
[bq="trashboat"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54bcbf086368721b14880f00#post_54bcbf086368721b14880f00
Both sides here are jackasses.[/bq]
I totally admit I'm being a jackass, but I'm right about the aliens creating humans trope being easily the most popular science fiction trope of all time.


If you want to watch a science fiction movie about ancient aliens expediting human evolution that doesn't involve emotionally scarred individuals and far more symbolism I would suggest 2001: A Space Odyssey.

Or if you want a science fiction in which human civilization is started by aliens and lots of religious symbolism I would suggest Stargate.

Or if you want both a science fiction about ancient aliens creating humans and the ancient aliens being "god" I would suggest the Aliens franchise.

Or Doctor who.

Or Jokestar.

Or Xenogears.

Or aliens putting all life on Earth watch South Park.
